explanation:
The agent's scenario is hypothetical but not supported by the code shown. MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 forbids modifying a function parameter. Merely taking the address of a parameter and passing that address to another function is not itself a modification. In the supplied code lfs_fs_grow_ the only place &block_count is passed is to lfs_fs_traverse_. There is no evidence in the provided code that lfs_fs_traverse_ or the callback actually write through that pointer and thus modify the parameter. Also the originally quoted function lfs_fs_grow (top of the report) does not take or pass &block_count — the address-of occurs in lfs_fs_grow_, so the agent mixed up the functions.

Therefore, based on the code shown, there is no demonstrated violation of Rule 17.8. If lfs_fs_traverse_ or the callback were known to write through the pointer, that would indeed modify the parameter and would violate Rule 17.8; but that is not established here. To be safe/defensive one could pass the address of a local non-parameter copy (or a const pointer) if modification must be prevented, but as-is the report is not correct.
